title: 旧约 - 诗篇(Psalms) - 第 65 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 诗篇(Psalms) -- 第 65 章 ( 本篇共有 150 章 )

lineList.en: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
lineList.cn: （大卫的诗歌，交与伶长）神阿，锡安的人都等候赞美你，所许的愿，也要向你偿还。

lineList.en: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
lineList.cn: 听祷告的主阿，凡有血气的，都要来就你。

lineList.en: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
lineList.cn: 罪孽胜了我。至于我们的过犯，你都要赦免。

lineList.en: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
lineList.cn: 你所拣选，使他亲近你，住在你院中的，这人便为有福。我们必因你居所，你圣殿的美福知足了。

lineList.en: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:
lineList.cn: 拯救我们的神阿，你必以威严秉公义应允我们。你本是一切地极，和海上远处的人所倚靠的。

lineList.en: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:
lineList.cn: 他既以大能束腰，就用力量安定诸山。

lineList.en: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
lineList.cn: 使诸海的响声，和其中波浪的响声，并万民的喧哗，都平静了。

lineList.en: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
lineList.cn: 住在地极的人，因你的神迹惧怕。你使日出日落之地都欢呼。

lineList.en: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
lineList.cn: 你眷顾地，降下透雨，使地大得肥美。神的河满了水。你这样浇灌了地，好为人豫备五谷。

lineList.en: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.
lineList.cn: 你浇透地的犁沟，润平犁脊。降甘霖，使地软和。其中发长的，蒙你赐福。

lineList.en: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
lineList.cn: 你以恩典为年岁的冠冕。你的路径都滴下脂油。

lineList.en: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
lineList.cn: 滴在旷野的草场上。小山以欢乐束腰。

lineList.en: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
lineList.cn: 草场以羊群为衣。谷中也长满了五谷。这一切都欢呼歌唱。
